title: Using PIFDataModel: Managing and Validating JSON Schemas
text: PIFDataModel package provides tools manage, validate, document JSON schemas R. vignette demonstrates : 1. Load JSON schema package. 2. Validate JSON data schema. 3. Generate documentation schema. package designed facilitate integration validation structured JSON data R workflows.

title: Using PIFDataModel: Managing and Validating JSON Schemas
text: first step load schema using load_schema() function. function reads JSON schema file package’s inst/schemas/ directory converts R object.
code: # Load a schema schema <- load_schema("user_schema.json") print(schema)

title: Using PIFDataModel: Managing and Validating JSON Schemas
text: Use validate_schema() function check JSON object conforms specific schema. input can JSON string R object (converted JSON).
code: # JSON data as a string json_data <- '{"id": 1, "name": "Alice", "email": "alice@example.com"}'  # Validate the JSON data against the schema validate_schema(json_data, "user_schema.json")

title: Using PIFDataModel: Managing and Validating JSON Schemas
text: document_schema() function creates human-readable description schema markdown format. useful sharing documenting structure schemas.
code: # Generate markdown documentation for the schema doc <- document_schema("user_schema.json") cat(doc)

title: Using PIFDataModel: Managing and Validating JSON Schemas
text: schema validates user objects.

title: Using PIFDataModel: Managing and Validating JSON Schemas
text: id: Integer, required. name: String, required. email: String, must valid email.
